questiontext.text: A variable A is normally distributed according to N(μ,σ²). We draw a sample of size n from this distribution, with mean \(\bar{x}\) and sd s. Then it follows that the quantity \(\frac{\bar{A}-\mu }{\frac{s}{\sqrt{n}}}\) the following distribution:

feedback.text: N(0,1), the standard normal distribution: Incorrect

answer.text: T[n], the T-distribution with n degrees of freedom

feedback.text: T[n], the T distribution with n degrees of freedom: Incorrect

answer.text: T[n-1], the T-distribution with n-1 degrees of freedom

feedback.text: T[n-1], the T distribution with n-1 degrees of freedom: Correct

answer.text: N(μ,σ²), the normal distribution with mean μ and variance σ²

feedback.text: N(μ,σ²), the normal distribution with mean μ and variance σ²: Incorrect
